intro: Chorizanthe brevicornu var. spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed jointweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and spiny stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it well adapted to drought conditions and high temperatures.
